11.content:
Pain. Ache. Throb.

Sasuke's head hurt.

Sear. Stab. Thud.

Why did it hurt?

"You are weak."

Brother? What are you doing? Why are Mom and Dad on the floor?

"You are weak, because you lack hatred."

Why are you holding that sword? Why is it covered in blood?

"Run. Run, and live in an unsightly manner.."

Why did you kill them, Brother?!

"I did it to test the limits of my ability. But they were too weak. They were not a true test. You, my little brother... You must become stronger. There is a certain shrine, near a certain river in the compound... Go there, and you shall learn the secret of the Uchiha Clan, and the path to true power. So run. Flee, and live with hatred. Despise me, loathe me, abhor me. Grow strong. And, when you have eyes like mine..."

Brother...

Why are you crying?

* * * * *


Sasuke awoke with a cry, feeling a burning in his eyes, a burn wholly unrelated to the tears which streamed now freely down his cheeks. He was trembling, he was shaking. Fear filled him.

He did not need to look around to know where he was. His eyes could see it clearly. All too clearly. All too sharply. Yet he did not need sight to know where he was. It was the same place he had been ever since...

No. He could not think about that.

He was in the hospital.

His family was dead, his brother was a traitor. And he himself was locked up in the intensive care ward. He had been for a week, now.

"Poor kid..." he heard one of the orderlies remark, passing down the hall past his room. "After everything else that's happened to him, having to be kept in here for the psych team to poke and prod at... I don't envy him."

"He has to be kept in here," remarked his companion. "For his own safety, if nothing else. Whatever Itachi did to him... It doesn't look like anything I've ever seen."

Sasuke winced. He knew what they were talking about.

The tears he wept were not clear ones. They were not water, salty or otherwise. No, they were red, deep red, and coppery, a metallic stench that clung to the back of his throat and reminded him all too much of the...

His mother and father's bodies were lying on the floor. They were perforated with precisely, barely noticeable sword-wounds. If not for the blood, it wouldn't have been visible at all.

He fought back a retch.

Itachi had done something to him. His eyes were burning. They burned and burned and burned with an unquenchable fire, a fire that refused to be doused no matter what he did. It was hot and painful, and it afflicted his eyes with an unbearable agony. And it left him weak, so weak he could not even move.

He was bedridden, continuously so. Severe chakra exhaustion, the doctors had called it. They said his eyes were siphoning most of the chakra from his body, constantly draining his reserves to the point of near constant emptiness. They had to mainline him liquefied soldier pills just to keep him from dying of chakra exhaustion.

And even as young as he was, he knew that this wasn't good. Whatever Itachi had done to him, it was slowly killing him. The doctors said his body was slowly adapting to the continuous drain on his chakra, that within a couple of months he would be well enough to return to the Academy, but "a couple of months" wasn't good enough for him.

He had to get stronger. He had to avenge his family. He had to kill his brother.

And he had to restore his clan.

This last thought, in particular, stuck in his mind. He knew what the act of "restoring" his clan would most likely entail, and that anyone he made bonds with would be at risk of death, or worse...

But he could not help but fixate on it. In one universe, Sasuke Uchiha would have obsessed with getting stronger.

But in this one, with twin, crimson, six-pointed stars peering out from pools of black, surrounded by white, with black, three-pointed stars within them, circles overlapping circles in a kaleidoscope of crimson and sable, staring back at him from every reflective surface into which he looked...

Sasuke found himself growing more obsessed with restoring his clan, than with avenging it. In his eyes, he saw the sharingan, yet it was not the sharingan. Not like the eyes of his mother or his father. No, it was something else. It was sharingan, yet also not sharingan.

Mangekyou. Wasn't that what Itachi had called it? Yes, mangekyou sharingan. That's what it was. He did not know how, but he already had eyes like Itachi's. Only greater than his, more complex and intricate and permanent.

Even as it drained him and left him bedridden, Sasuke knew, on some borderline instinctive level, that these eyes would take him far. They could give him the power to defeat Itachi, once he learned how to use them.

He already had the eyes he needed to take out his brother. Now, he could focus on restoring his clan. He would train, of course, but he would also do everything in his power to repopulate the Uchiha.

He was sure of this.

But, when did he start?

114.content:
Without an ounce of effort, Sasuke formed the requisite handseals. A puff of smoke later, and five perfect copies were standing behind him.

"Congratulations!" said the assistant instructor Mizuki (last-name-not-important-enough-to-learn), "You are now a genin, Sasuke."

The last loyal Uchiha resisted the urge to scoff. Of course he was a genin. The idea that he might have failed this pitiful excuse for a graduation test was simply preposterous. Even a complete dead-last like Naruto shouldn't have any trouble with something as basic and fundamental as the clone jutsu.

"Here, Sasuke," said the main instructor, Iruka Umino, who was a marginally more notable individual than Mizuki. At the very least, he was fair, and not a complete sycophant like most of the other faculty and students. The career chuunin, entirely unremarkable aside from his dedication as an instructor, and his ability to rein in even the worst troublemakers in their class, grabbed a standard issue forehead protector from a pile of identical items and handed it to the most recent graduate.

"You've earned it," was what the man told Sasuke, before dismissing him to call in the next examinee.

The young prodigy once more resisted the urge to scoff, simply turning on his heels after accepting the headband. Holding the proof of his graduation in his hand, Sasuke's mind turned for the first time in a while to his plans. His goals.

He wasn't even really paying attention to his surroundings as he walked out of the Academy, heading through the crowd of other students who had already taken the exam. Nobody seemed to have failed, of course, which was only to be expected with such a simple test. But he didn't pay them any heed, anyways.

Not the boys, at least.

No, he was thinking of things he had not considered since returning to the Academy after the Massacre. He was considering matters of blood, and joining, and repopulating the Uchiha. Sasuke had made considerable strides in gaining control of his powers -- Eternal Mangekyou Sharingan, that tablet in that room under that mat in that shrine, had said it was called -- and now he was officially a shinobi of Konoha.

A whole world of training possibilities was now open to him, options which were simply not available to civilians or Academy students. But, more importantly, he was now legally an adult.

He could now begin properly repopulating his clan. With the powers of his sharingan, and his considerable fan following, it would be no problem for Sasuke to find willing females, and with a bit of mental conditioning from Tsukuyomi, he was certain that he could shape just about any girl he wished into a suitable mother of Uchiha children.

Yes, he was already decided on the matter. He would begin sowing his oats, the oats of the Uchiha. He would spread his seed far and wide, spawn Uchiha wherever he could find viable women. He would father a nation. The Uchiha would be a clan once more, a clan and more.

The Uchiha would be everywhere. He would make sure of it.

But where would he start?

For his first targets, Sasuke chose his two most rabid fangirls, Ino Yamanaka and Sakura Haruno. The two had broken off a friendship over their mutual attraction to him, and of all the girls in his year, they were two of the highest scoring.

Ino, for instance, had the absolute highest cumulative, overall score in their grade, and Sakura was one of the most studious people in the Academy, with the best scores in the theoretical areas. Both were intelligent, in their own way, and Ino in particular had good, strong shinobi genes that could only benefit the next generation of Uchiha.

Furthermore, both girls had frequently professed their affections for him, in very unsubtle ways. Before, he had brushed them off in order to focus on his studies. But now.

Oh, but now...

He would take them up on their offers, both spoken and unspoken. He would give the two girls everything they needed from him, and everything he needed to give them.

They would make an excellent start.

Sakura was the first he tracked down. She had already taken her test, a while before Sasuke himself, and she had quite vocally announced her passing grade. In particular, she had been beaming very girlishly in his direction, looking rather... cute, in all honesty. But now, Sakura was sitting by herself, cheerfully reading through one of their class textbooks.

She brushed a strand of long pink hair out of her face, and Sasuke wondered for a moment who had started that preposterous rumor about him preferring girls with long hair. I mean, to be certain, he could appreciate the aesthetic appeal, but it was rather impractical for kunoichi.

Well, he could correct that later. But first things first.

"Hey, Sakura," he said, greeting the slender pinkette. "You look pretty cute, today.

"Sa-Sasuke-kun...!" the lass yelped, practically jumping out of her seat as she whipped her head up to look him in the eyes. She was blushing a deep, rosy red that very closely matched the color of her outfit. Her eyes were wide, half from shock that he had acknowledged her existence with anything more than an irritated grunt, and half with the sheer blind adoration that she and most of the other girls in Sasuke's age bracket held for him. "Y-you do...!"

Whatever she was about to say, it did not get finished. Sasuke pressed an index finger softly to Sakura's lips, smiling confidently as he looked into her gleaming emerald eyes.

"Hush," he told her. "Don't talk. Just look into my eyes..."

Onyx orbs, even as he spoke, tingled and burned before morphing, shifting and changing into the crimson and sable of his eternal mangekyou sharingan. For a moment, Sakura stared into his eyes with wonderment, transfixed. Time seemed to stand still as they gazed into one another's eyes.

Then the moment passed, and the genjutsu ended.

Sakura's eyelids drooped a little, pupils unfocusing for a second as a pattern mirroring his sharingan briefly seemed to flicker in her eyes. She smiled, then, and nodded slowly.

"Of course, Sasuke-sama..." she murmured, having received her mental instructions.

Sasuke allowed himself a small, victorious smirk, nodding back at Sakura before turning to go look for Ino. The pinkette seemed to return to her normal temperament and behavioral patterns once eye contact was broken, but Sasuke knew that the commands had been successfully implanted. When the time came, he would give her a more thorough conditioning, but until then just this much would have to suffice.

Next, he sought out Ino, managing to catch her right as she exited the testing room. He repeated the process with her, looking into the girl's eyes and giving her instructions via genjutsu. She nodded, smiling, addressing him as "Sasuke-sama," before returning to what she had been doing once he left.

And Sasuke, smirking, went outside to do a bit of light target practice.

The commands had been planted. They would meet him at the specified place, at the specified time.

Now it was just a matter of waiting.

But where did they meet him, and when? Behind the Academy, once it let out? Or at the Uchiha compound, sometime in the evening? Or perhaps inside a certain shed, in a certain clearing, well after dark?

In a forest clearing at the edge of the village, a certain abandoned shed stood alone and disused. Sasuke was not sure what the structure original purpose had been, but it was dilapidated and empty now. It looked like the building had not been used in decades.

Perfect for Sasuke's purposes.

He arrived an hour before dusk, wearing his brand new forehead protector. The interior of the shed was empty, the air musty. Grime was thick on the windows.

People would not be able to see inside the shed, if they happened to come across it. And after casting a subtle, one-way sound dampening genjutsu on the premises, Sasuke was equally confident that no one would be able to hear anything inside it, either.

With that out of the way, Konoha's last loyal Uchiha produced a small scroll from his pocket. It was labeled in roman lettering, "FCRA-U1h".

Sasuke smiled idly, turning the scroll over in his hands. It had been a rather curious stroke of luck which led the boy to discovering a certain old, unused bylaw from around the time of Konoha's founding.

CRA was a widespread concept among shinobi, an old tradition among the feudal lords intended to keep clans with valuable hiden or kekkei genkai from dying out. The Clan Repopulation Articles had been frequently invoked by daimyo of various countries throughout the warring states era as a way to ensure that valued ninja clans would not die out for lack of new offspring.

Invocation of the CRA for a clan traditionally meant that the men of that family were legally permitted by the daimyo (and in many cases contractually obligated) to take multiple wives in order to maximize the rate of childbirths for that family. A man who carried a signed writ of consent from the daimyo was allowed to take any woman he desired as a concubine, so long as she was fertile and capable of bearing children.

Whether the woman in question consented to this was deemed irrelevant in those days. In some places it was still that way.

But the CRA was considered a relic of the past in modern shinobi villages. Changes in social mores, and shifts in the political climate, had rendered CRA obsolete. For various reasons, the great hidden villages generally outlawed such practices, and those who attempted to invoke CRA were usually treated to ridicule by the legally savvy.

The Clan Repopulation Articles were no longer considered legitimate among magistrates. Even members of near-extinct clans could no longer take numerous wives without facing a civil suit.

This was generally common knowledge.

Less commonly known, however, was that in Konoha's founding articles there actually remained a very specific set of provisions for the two founding clans. If either the Uchiha or Senju, as a result of external or internal strife, were reduced to a population less than ten percent of quorum (generally held as fifty clan shinobi active within the village) with reasonably low probability of recovering to an acceptable level of strength via standard measures, the highest ranking surviving male member of that clan would be permitted all the same privileges as outlined in the original Articles of Clan Repopulation.

This was the Founding Clan Restoration Act, intended to maintain a balance of power between the rival Senju and Uchiha families. Sasuke had already done his research to make sure this bylaw hadn't been amended or annulled in the decades since Konoha's founding, even going so far as to submit a tentative inquiry to the office of the Hokage a year back.

Lord Sandaime had replied (unusually promptly) that he would make provisions for a declaration of FCRA-U1h -- the section of the Village's founding articles which retained the right of the Uchiha clan in particular to declare an S-class priority Clan Restoration in the event of potential bloodline extinction.

The scroll in Sasuke's hands had been waiting for him in a secure envelope when he got home from the Academy, sealed tight with a jutsu formula keyed exclusively to his blood.

As the last loyal surviving Uchiha in the Hidden Leaf, Sasuke could legally take any woman he wanted within the boundaries of the Land of Fire (whether or not said woman was a citizen of Hi no kuni) and make her his concubine. There was no limit to how many he could take, nor any regulations on how he should treat or house them so long as it did not adversely affect the chances of a fetus being successfully carried to term.

The only real stipulations were that a prospective concubine had to sign the scroll in Sasuke's hands. Willingness on the woman's part was not explicitly mandatory, which said volumes considering the aptitude of sharingan-wielders for genjutsu compulsion.

Of course, in order to keep his concubines, Sasuke would be legally required to impregnate each one at least once every three years. Which made perfect sense, considering that the entire point of FCRA was to repopulate the founding clans in event of near extinction.

So, yes, Sasuke had plenty of reason to smile as he waited for Ino and Sakura to show up.

I want you to create fifty clones and have them work on nature transformation, and another fifty to work on chakra control. he created the clones along with naruko and they went to another area to train.

"what about me," asked naruko.

"you will work physically," said orochimaru. "give me a hundred laps."







What next?

1353222221212112113232112111112113.content:
Sasuke and Naruko were both panting heavily once Orochimaru finally called todays training to an end. "that was brutal," said naruko. "it was nothing like the lazy cyclops."

"agreed and it even helped that he showed up before us and not made us wait two hours for him," said sasuke as he regained his breath.

"not bad for your first day," said Orochimaru. "but I know you both can do better. expect me to push both of you to your limits everyday."

"yes sensei," the two said.

"good now naruko go see Kabuto for a check up and sasuke stay back for a moment I have a few things I want to talk to you about."

the two nodded there head and naruko made her way out of the room. she stopped at the entance and asked, "sensei where would kabuto be right now? and where would i find it?"

Orochimaru let out a small sigh of iritation but didnt blame the blond. most had touble navigating the tunnels for at least a month and she just got here yesteday. he summoned a small snake and had it slither over to naruko. "my summon will lead you to him.

"thank you sensei," naruko said as she followed the snake.

kabuto ran a few jutsu's on her till he found something strange. "huh what this? oh my so that is the problem," he said.

what is the problem?

154.content:
Naruto, Sasuke and Sakura had just finished facing the Goddess of Chakra, Kayuya Otsutsuki. Both Naruto and Sasuke had used the powers of the Goddess' son and grandsons, and with the combined effort of both they had managed to seal away the Goddess once again and free the Tailed Beasts from the Demonic Statue.

With the parting words of the deceased, and the Sage of Six Paths returning to the afterlife after his son's reincarnation's had saved the world, things were looking pretty good for the future.

However, everything went to shit for Naruto. Sasuke, the one who he had thought had thrown away his evil ways had turned against him. Sasuke saw him as a threat and wanted to make sure he was not around to threaten his plan of complete annihilation of the ninja populace. Everything that had happened to him, from Itachi's killing of his family, to Konoha's betrayal of him, and of course the manipulations of everyone had made him resent the very idea of ninjas.

Sasuke knew the blonde haired container would not agree to his plans and decided to get rid of him. So with a last minute Susanoo, and a well-placed Kamui, the Uchiha had pushed the blonde through the portal. That was not the end however, the seal on Naruto's stomach, the one powered by the God of Death had failed at that very moment. It seemed the god's power did not transcend the gaps between different dimensions.

The purification of Yin-Kurama's chakra stopped and the cage that once held it flew open. Yin-Kurama had been pumping its chakra through Naruto's Chakra coils without any restraint due to their new partnership and the intense battle they had been through. And when the seal had broken without its knowledge, it had contnued to process its chakra through the boy. The red bubbling chakra burned through the shinobi's pathways causing the boy an intense amount of pain.

In addition to that, Yin-Kurama was expelled from the seal in a massive burst of chakra. The ripping of the Tailed Beast from his stomach and some of its chakra only added to the pain Naruto was going through. Through the haze of pain, Naruto had managed to catch the sight of Sasuke staring into the eyes of the confused and exhaused yin-nine tailed fox. He had tried to release a warning, a shout, a scream, absolutely anything to warn the fox. But it was too late.

Just as the inter-dimensional portal began to close, he could see the fox's orange pupils be replaced with Sasuke's signature sharingan, before the Uchiha turned to face the rest of them.

155.content: Sasuke was jumping from tree to tree intent on getting to Konoha as soon as possible. Since the five Great shinobi villages were fighting the Akatsuki and the ten tails, Konoha would be at is most vulnerable at this point. He had decided that since Konoha would be at is weakest he would sneak in and impregnate a few women there and their children will be the next generation of the Uchiha clan.

info.description:
So, there are plenty of stories where Naruto gets to bag tons of babes... But what about his rival, Sasuke? I say, hey, why not! Depending on when you want to set this, of course, it might get pretty dark... but then that's just par for the course, innit?

The same general rules from my other harem interactives can be expected to apply here also.

http://www.writing.com/main/interact/item_id/1939418-Sokkas-Harem
http://www.writing.com/main/interact/item_id/1935036-Naruto-Last-Man-Alive
http://www.writing.com/main/interact/item_id/1901170-Hayate-Hypno-Harem
http://www.writing.com/main/interact/item_id/1954148-Mating-Season-Beast-Boy-in-...

Also, please, if you're going to add, try to add something with actual content. Meaningless single sentence choice chapter can be very wearisome to read through, and if you're adding those, you should at least also try to add an equal or greater number of chapters with actual stuff going on in them. I'm not expecting novel length entries or anything like that, but at least TRY to contribute something to the plot (inasmuch as there is one) in some appreciable way with your adds.

That said, I do try to also add to the stories of those people who add to mine, and while this would seem like just plain common courtesy, it's still apparently exceptional enough to warrant noting. Plus, it can work as incentive to get y'all adding! :D
